did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Ben Roche, Jr. Papers
did.abstract: Papers of Washington State University Range Management Specialist Ben F. Roche.

bioghist.p: Benjamin Francis Roche, Jr. (1924-1997) was an expert on weeds and range plants. From 1958 to 1965, he worked as an Extension Weed Specialist for the State of Washington. From 1965 to 1987, he worked for Washington State University in the Department of Natural Resource Sciences as the institution's first Extension Range Management Specialist. His research was linked to range resource problems in Washington and surrounding states, and during his time at WSU he trained many Range Conservationists.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of papers of Washington State University Range Management Specialist Ben F. Roche. It includes the manuscript for his 1983 book, Range Plants: Their Identification, Usefulness, and Management; plant collection books kept by Cindy Talbott Roche; writings and presentations; and other miscellaneous papers.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Ben Roche, Jr. Papers, 1965-1994 (MS.1999.37)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: Richard Old donated this collection to the Washington State University Libraries in 1999 (MS.1999.37). He obtained the collection from Cindy Talbott Roche.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
